title: 108_s2233
content: The Act may be cited as the "Environmental Research Enhancement Act" and pertains to Environmental Protection Agency research activities. The Environmental Research Enhancement Act establishes the position of Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency. The Deputy Administrator will be appointed by the President with the advice and consent of the Senate. The President appoints the Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency with Senate approval. Recommendations from the National Academy of Sciences, National Academy of Engineering, and Science Advisory Board are considered for the appointment. The Deputy Administrator oversees the Office of Research. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency coordinates and oversees various scientific and technical activities within the Agency, including the Office of Research and Development, the Office of Environmental Information, the Science Advisory Board, and the Science Policy Council. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency is responsible for identifying important scientific issues, developing an Agency-wide strategy for acquiring and disseminating scientific information, and collaborating with academia, other government agencies, and the private sector in the United States. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency collaborates with academia, government agencies, and the private sector in the US and abroad to ensure the Agency's scientific outreach and communication needs are met. This includes providing credible science to support regulatory and policy deliberations at all levels within the Agency and reaching out to a broader national and international audience. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology at the Environmental Protection Agency coordinates scientific quality assurance, peer-review activities, and ensures appropriate scientific information is used in decision-making at all levels within the Agency. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology at the Environmental Protection Agency oversees the support of regulatory and regional offices, develops processes for using scientific information in decision-making, and ensures the validity and appropriate application of scientific information in regulatory decisions and policies. The Assistant Administrator for Research and Development of the Environmental Protection Agency is appointed for a 6-year term, and a program is established to recruit senior research appointments in the Office of Research and Development Laboratories. The head of the Office, in consultation with advisory boards, establishes a program to recruit senior researchers for environmental research. Awards are given to support research in advancing areas related to the Agency's mission and to train junior researchers. The Office establishes a program to recruit senior researchers for environmental research. Awards are given to support research in advancing areas related to the Agency's mission and to train junior researchers. Selection procedures are established for award recipients, and awards are given for a 5-year period and may be renewed. Each laboratory of the Office must have at least 1 senior researcher appointed under the program. The Office of Research and Development establishes a program to recruit senior researchers for environmental research. Each laboratory must have at least 1 senior researcher appointed under the program. Appropriations are authorized for carrying out this subsection. The Office aims to give research managers flexibility and accountability in decision-making. The Office of Research and Development aims to empower research managers with decision-making flexibility and accountability. They strive to maintain a balance between core and problem-driven research, implement strategies to acquire and apply research results from various sources, and enhance documentation practices. The Office of Research and Development aims to empower research managers with decision-making flexibility and accountability by improving documentation and transparency in decision-making processes, actively disseminating research products, and increasing research efforts. The Agency aims to increase efforts in disseminating research products, explaining their significance, and assisting others in applying the results. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology will expand the science inventory by documenting and publishing a detailed inventory of all scientific activities conducted by Agency units. The Agency's Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology will expand the science inventory by documenting and publishing a comprehensive inventory of all scientific activities conducted by Agency units, including project goals, milestones, schedules, principal investigators, project managers, staff and financial resource allocations. This information will be used to ensure proper coordination through the Agency-wide science planning and budgeting process. The Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management at the Environmental Protection Agency will oversee the coordination of scientific activities through the Agency-wide planning process and implement a new peer-review policy to ensure independence from program managers. The position of Deputy Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency is redesignated as the position of "Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management of the Environmental Protection Agency." Any references to the Deputy Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency will now refer to the Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management of the Environmental Protection Agency. The position of Deputy Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency is now split into two roles: Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management, and Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology.
